title.narrative: RESEARCH CAP BUILDING FOR WIN AFRODAD

description.narrative:
AFRODAD will be receiving strategic funding from Oxfam Novib which is directed to contribute to each of the 4 thematic programme areas of AFRODAD#s programme for 2012-2015 which focuses on:
(a) Debt Management
1. To influence African Governments toimprove the management of debt resources by 2015. 2. To develop capacity to understand the implications and influence outcomes of Publicly Supported Private Financing by 2015.
(b) Development Aid 1. To influence African Governments and donors to putin place mechanisms for aid effectiveness and sustainable development by 2015. 2. To influence the consolidation of capacity among African states to understand and engage on the implications of aid from emerging sources (BRICS), and monitor its effects ondevelopment and poverty reductionby 2015.
(c) Economic Governance 1. To influence African Governments to develop and implement transparent, accountable and efficient mechanisms for mobilisation and utilisation of domestic resources by 2015. 2. Toinfluence African Governments to develop and implement alternative macroeconomic policies that would facilitate economic growth, and equitable and sustainable development by 2015.
(d) Institutional Development 1. To strengthen the capacity of AFRODAD secretariat in programme and organisational management and improve its financial status by 2015.

participating-org.narrative: AFRODAD African Forum network on debt & dev

The African Forum Network on Debt and Development (AFRODAD) is a Harare-based network and a think-tank working on Debt Management, Aid Effectiveness and Economic Governance. It was formed in 1996 and sprang from regional collaboration in research and lobby on debt relief and structural adjustment programs. AFRODAD#s partnership is made up of national organisations and networks working on debtand macro-economic issues. As of today, AFRODAD has 16 national partners devoted to work on debt, aid and development issues. AFRODAD is an active player in African civil society as an active member of the Africa Social Forum council and is engaged to the AfricanUnion#s Civil Society Platform of the ECOSOC Council. The principal results of AFRODAD's research, policy and analysis and advocacyover the past years, has been its ability to champion and bring the African debt, aid and economic justice issues to the fore of the national, the AU#s and the international community#s agendas. It has spearheaded a macro-economic training program for CSOs acrossthe continent. One of AFRODAD's recent major achievements was it contribution to Liberia#s debt relief of hundreds of millions of dollars in 2007.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation

receiver-org.narrative: AFRODAD African Forum network on debt & dev

description.narrative: no. of cases that show how partner organisations use new tools to measure and improve the legitimacy and risk management of organisations, with a special focus on (women) organisations in countries with repression and conflict.
